law.catch_line: Using slugs in the first degree.

text.section:
A person is guilty of unlawfully using slugs in the first degree when:
He makes, possesses or disposes of slugs with intent to enable a person to insert, deposit or use them in a coin machine; and
The value of such slugs exceeds $100.
Unlawfully using slugs in the first degree is a Class D felony.

law.history: Created 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 406, sec. 143, effective January 1, 1975.
